title: `unreachable_pub` lint does not fire in the case of partial wildcard shadowing

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
#![deny(unreachable_pub)]

pub use berp::*;

// 1.
// use darp::Foo;

pub fn example() {
    let _ = Foo;
}

pub mod berp {
    pub struct Foo;
    // 2.
    // pub struct Bar;

    impl Foo {
        pub fn hah(&self) {}
        pub fn hoh(&self) {}
    }
}

pub mod darp {
    pub struct Foo;
}
```

I expected to see this happen:

When I uncomment `1.` (but not `2.`) above, the lint correctly fires, and says:

```
error: unreachable `pub` item
 --> /tmp/breaky/breaky/src/lib.rs:3:9
  |
3 | pub use berp::*;
  | ---     ^^^^
  | |
  | help: consider restricting its visibility: `pub(crate)`
  |
  = help: or consider exporting it for use by other crates
note: the lint level is defined here
 --> /tmp/breaky/breaky/src/lib.rs:1:8
  |
1 | #[deny(unreachable_pub)]
  |        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

When I uncomment `1.` AND `2.` above, the lint no longer fires, despite the export being shadowed (though - it is still otherwise reachable).

```
   Compiling breaky v0.1.0 (/tmp/breaky/breaky)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.06s
```

### Meta

```
active toolchain
----------------

stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu (default)
rustc 1.68.0 (2c8cc3432 2023-03-06)
```

Context from [discussion on reddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/rust/comments/13bs8qc/breaking_semver_in_rust_by_adding_a_private_type/#jjcr7p5), and [other wildcard shadowing shenanigans](https://predr.ag/blog/breaking-semver-in-rust-by-adding-private-type-or-import/)

edit: made it `#![deny(unreachable_pub)]` not `#[deny(unreachable_pub)]`
